intro: Liriosma velloziana, commonly known as the velvetleaf or creeping liriosma, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit, allowing it to spread aggressively in moist, shaded environments. The plant features elongated, lance-shaped leaves with a velvety texture, often covered in fine hairs. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically green or white, followed by triangular, three-lobed berries. Liriosma velloziana is often considered a weed in agricultural settings due to its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils.
